texto1:
The Euroscut Açores highway is 93.7 km long and is designed on three main axes:
The southern axis connects the airport with the south of the Island. 30 km (10.8 km existing, 7.7 km refurbished and 11.5 km of new construction)
The northern axis improves the connection between the Island’s two biggest towns. 31.9 km (5.4 km existing, 15.7 km refurbished and 10.7 km of new construction with 2 carriageway)
And lastly the north-eastern axis improves connection with Sâo Miguel’s less developed areas. 25.6 km of new construction with 1 carriageway.

This is one of Portugal’s most complex engineering projects. The geography of the Island reflects its volcanic origins, and it was necessary to find some creative solutions involving high investment in infrastructures. The highway is remarkable for its 27 viaducts, especially the Despe-te que suas overpass with its 185 m between main pillars.
